result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James T. Shafer

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: It is ordered that Attorney James Krave is withdrawn as counsel.
records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt: Motion and Proposed Order to Withdraw as Counsel by Attorney James Krave
records.descr: Motion and prop. order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.

2:41 PM Cases called: 20CF227, 22CF257 &  22CF258. Defendant James T. Shafer in court.  Attorney James H Krave in court for James T. Shafer.  Attorney Andrew James Gunderson in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant has an open case in Chippewa County with Attorney Rivard that is to be set for a jury trial. 
Attorney Krave is requesting to withdraw as he is closing his practice and to have another prosecutor appointed. Court grants Attorney Krave's request. Attorney Krave will file a Motion and Order for the Judge's signature. 
STC:11/11/22 at 10am (15min in person)

Conditions:
No contact with 1200 block of Garfield Ave
No contact with anyone involved in illegal drug activities, except in a therapeutic setting. 
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
(Covers 22CF227, 22CF257, 22CF258)
Plea hearing on August 22, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

1:27 PM Cases called: 22CF227, 22CF257 & 22CF258. Defendant James T. Shafer in court, in custody.  Attorney James H Krave in court for James T. Shafer.  Attorney Andrew James Gunderson in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant has open cases in Chippewa County and would like to incorporate both counties in a resolution, possibly. Defense asks for one more adjournment. 

Plea Hearing: 08/22/22 at 3:30pm. 30 min in person
Plea hearing on July 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

(Cases 22CF227, 22CF257, 22CF258 are called at 9:16 AM) Defendant James T. Shafer in court, in custody.  Attorney James H Krave in court for James T. Shafer.  Attorney Loralee Clark in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defense indicates there may be an agreement,  however there is no paperwork prepared- requests to schedule a plea hearing. 
Plea Hearing: 07/12/2022 at 1:30 PM.
Status conference on June 10, 2022 at 09:15 am.

Cases called at 8:49 AM: 22CF227, 22CF257, 22CF258
Defendant James T. Shafer in court, in custody with Attorney James H Krave.  Attorney Matthew Kirkpatrick in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waives reading of Informations and enters Not Guilty pleas in all 3 cases. Court grants 20 days to file motions.
STC: 6/10/22 at 9:15 AM (in person).

9:41 AM cases 22CF257, 22CF227, 22CF258 called. Prosecuting attorney Trenton John Piltz Mr in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant James T. Shafer in court, in custody.  Attorney James H Krave in court for James T. Shafer. 
In all files: Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waiver. All files are referred to Branch 2 to schedule ARGN.

Conditions:
No contact with 1200 block of Garfield Ave
No contact with anyone involved in illegal drug activities, except in a therapeutic setting. 
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
(Covers 22CF227, 22CF257, 22CF258)

**Defendant refused to sign.**

(11:14 AM cases 22CF227, 22CF257, 22CF258 called.) Prosecuting attorney Tiffany M. Winter appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant James T. Shafer appeared by video, in custody in the Eau Claire County Jail. Attorney Sonia L Anderson appeared by video for James T. Shafer. 
Court orders warrants are quashed.
Defendant acknowledges receipt of the complaints and waives time limits for preliminary hearing.
Defendant updates phone number with the Court.
Pre-Trial Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on March 21, 2022 at 2:15 pm.
Hearing scheduled for April 14, 2022 at 09:30 am.
